content: Installed the app to refresh SQL knowledge. I was about to abandon the app when I had to choose between web development and python. Luckily, at last I found the course I needed. Having finished the course, I find it pretty boring, with too simple tasks that didn't really reinforce knowledge. Especially it was inconvenient to type commands on the phone keyboard. + No free certificates :( On the good side, the gamification engine with streaks and leaderboards seemed engaging.
replyContent: Hi there, thank you for the feedback. We also have a web version now for people who prefer to type the codes instead of studying on their phone. We already keep all our content for free so a few things are available for Pro users only such as certificates!

content: The app is good and I learned python from it. I'm giving it 3 stars because when I run out of hearts, I can't do any more lessons for 3 hours. I can't even practice to get the hearts back. So that's why I lost my hard earned 82 day streak. The app also crashes when you run out of hearts. I would love if you can fix this, that the app will be amazing!

Overall great app but glitched af can't progress in python lessons becuse everytime i finish one lesson it does not count it even tho i finished it im getting 0Xp for it and can't progress to next lesson please fix as soon possible couse is unplayable right now.

THIS IS THE PERFECT APP I NEEDED! i tried programming hero and programming hub and some other apps, but no one worked with me. BUT I CANNOT BELIEVE IM FINALLY KNOWING HOW TO CODE BECAUSE OF THIS! Thanks you so much for this amazing app. Edit: this app was really amazing until the new update where i lost all my progress. Im not a professional python programmer but i still have more to learn. Like suddenly the app resets all the progress and now i need to start from variables.
Love this app! Great starting point for learning python.

Ok could be a few more languages even if it's pro only so far looks like html SQL python and CSS there might be more in pro but I can't account at moment as still behind pay wall its number 1 on play for a reason nice social with projects and playrooms so I give it 5 stars the pay part is so we can cloth and feed the dedicated developers im fine with that also if its hard to learn with this style of teaching simple get a note pad and make notes for future reference no time limit

I personally learned a lot of stuff like that when you want to make something strong like the word dog slaps cat you do this * dog slaps cat * and if you forget something you just swipe and It is like Duolingo but for coding as a unity user I am glad I found this now I will be using python to create a social app were you can see who whatchrd which message

What's up guys , it's a good application for learning programming but here is my challenging question from my side to the developers and managrment of this application ;can I also receive my certificate immediately after paying for the monthly pro version/plan? Remember that am talking about the web development part not python and SQL

I love it! It's like Duolingo but with drastically better explanations and for code. I wasn't super serious about learning python but with every new function I've learned, I've gotten more and more excited about it and have been playing on this on all of my work breaks. I can tell that A LOT of thought and careful planning went into making this app and I really really appreciate it!
So far so good. Learning the basic of the basics of python. Will update If I'm unsatisfied with my progress.

Used it to learn python. Worked fine till a little beyond intermediate. Then said I was offline even though I was not. Logged out and all my progress was lost. While teaching it was pretty good. Too bad it has a severe technical glitch. Would not recommend.
replyContent: Yikes! We're sorry to hear you've run into an issue. To get to the bottom of the issue, please tell Johanna at support (support@getmimo.com) what exactly happened. She's great at figuring such things out.

content: It's a Good coding app but horrible customer service. After an update that removed half of the courses, my progess in the python track has been completely reset. I contacted customer service but they weren't very helpful retrieving my progress. They told me that I have to make sure I'm using the right account. But Im using the right account then how was I able to access premium in the first place? I just don't think they care for their users. You'll be spending $30+ annually for bad support
Awesome app and great for learning the python language..... And the plus point is that this app also provides u the certificate. I am using the app from 2 weeks and it's awesome

Mimo is an app that's value speaks for itself. $60 a year and a week long free trial, but they remind you when the trial ends with push notifications when the time gets close. They don't try to take your money if you forget because the app knows how to keep you coming back with stress-free, fun, competitive, and educational programming content. I'm using it to brush up on my python and learn SQL. Love Mimo.

I literally just downloaded this app in hopes that it would not disappoint, and so far it has not. It's very fun and simple to use and understand. I'm doing the python course and I feel I will a great grasp of the curriculum by the time my trial is over. It's a great app, it explains things very simply and clearly. I would keep it if I could pay for itüòÇüëåüèæ
Good introduction to python. I felt a need for more challenging exercises.

Nicely paced learning. However, content is now restricted to web (html, css and java script), python and sql. There is not enough here to justify a subscription and gameification is pointless and annoying once you've finished the content.
It's super disappointing how only 5 of 37 courses are available for free, this app only works if you wanna learn python or web development for free and for the rest you have to pay

So far so good. I've gotten pretty far and python because of Mimo. Some of the functions could be outdated but that's okay because it's small compared to what I have learned. The competition side is awesome!!! Constantly making me want to beat number one. I WILL BE NUMBER 1!

Too "beginner friendly". I checked that I do program a bit, and have small projects, and I've got very shallow introduction to python instead. I do know how to code in python more or less, so I don't see a point in starting all over with close to no level.
replyContent: Hi there! Thanks for your review. We're working hard to provide the best content that will allow our users from all levels to learn something new. Just keep going through the chapters and we promise it will get harder. Hang in there!

content: What an app...love it! Please add more programming languages. (Edit 30/05/21) There are a few issues that I have noticed: 1. I can no longer access the leaderboard it keeps saying finish another lesson. 2. All the older python lessons that I completed no longer show the complete list of sub topics that I completed.
replyContent: Yikes! We're sorry to hear you've run into an issue. To get to the bottom of the issue, please tell Johanna at support (support@getmimo.com) what exactly happened. She's great at figuring such things out.

content: I finished a module, it says I earned 80 points, but the leader board did not update. That is a frustrating bug. I will uninstall and get a book on python.
I've subscribed so I can't comment on ads. Completing this, on an 8 day streak so far, along with a python course has helped reinforce and introduce concepts well. Recommended

Great app to learn so much about different programming language basics, and some wider IT info too. Only gripe is the courses tab on Android which doesn't look as good or work as seamlessly as the main 3 learning tracks (sql, python, web design) and doesn't progress your current place in the course to the big green button, meaning you have to hunt for it.

An excellent way to learn how to code. I wanted to learn python for free for AGES and now I finally can! (Yes, I am a real person. A robot would not make a pointless comment within parentheses of a review.)

Very good app! Kill your time and learn! But... When you finish it even paid one option, mimo team add lessons with big delays... It takes around week waiting. Meantime you missing your day strike, rank position and losing will for further education. Mimo team please add more lessons, courses, and allow to get python certificate... Thanks

Absolutely amazing app. It is very useful for learning varities of programming languages from scratch to the top. It is very competitive as well, because of the leaderboards system. I will recommend you this application if you are a beginner, intermediate or even an expert at coding. This app will help you get more knowledge, for sure. üòÅ And yes, I am learning python.
Great app I am learning python and a great progress is made P.s-i am using the free version

I"ve been coding on and off for 25 years and I wanted to have as look at python. My son is using Mimo to learn some HTML so suggested I have a look at it. Learning ti code on my phone is not ideal but by breaking everything down into small chunks it's easy to find five minutes here and there to do a lesson. Yes it's a bit slow for me but add I can choose in other languages the basics it's stuff that I already know, but I do like the way it is done.

I liked it at first but just as i felt like it was getting to the interesting point of learning python it ran out of lessons. You can learn what is taught here for free on the python web site as well as a lot more.
A fun and competitive way to learn HTML , JavaScript, and python. You all must try it I know that you will love it.
This app is amazing to me you learn HTML CSS and JavaScript and you can do extra things to like learning about a.i and programming and inernet and network and challenges and python

I really liked the app to get a fist try at learning python, but I changed my phone and now, on the same day, it is no longer available. This is really disappointing because I was in the middle of the module.
Good, but dissapointed it doesn't have python

I downloaded this app in hopes that I could start learning on my mobile device, while im on the ferry, bus or train or even on lunch break at times. I went through the greeting tutorial on how the app works, then went on with the python course. I liked how it started taking me step by step and i was feeling that I was going to learn something. Well after 2 questions I got smacked with a Paywall to pay a very expensive monthly or yearly fee. People are better off with FreeCodeCamp. I uninstalled
I've learned coding easily and perfectly by Mimo, thank you guys, keep it up, and please add python challenge in the next updateüôè

please add more content on ansible python automation . please add python in earn certificate and in daily challenge . please add projects and new chapter in python i have buy for python but i think that it has very low study material in python . please update

As one who has experience in numerous programming languages, this seamlessly catches up to my skill level and expounds upon it. For learning new languages, however, I can't stress enough how easy it is to build new foundations! I let a 12 year old try learning python from scratch using this app, and in an hour they had progressed farther than I had in 2 and with fewer mistakes.

I've only just started python but I must admit the approach for learning is 
refreshing in comparison to long standing competitors like codecademy. I 
just really like how human the content feels, and the simple plain English 
(with the odd pop culture reference). I hope the app continues to feel this 
way throughout
